result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ronald Joseph Sienkiewicz was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 1/11/2018 - COURT GRANTS AND ORDERS REDUCTION OF DRIVER'S LICENSE REVOCATION FROM 36 MONTHS TO 24 MONTHS.

Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

1/11/2018 - COURT GRANTS AND ORDERS REDUCTION OF IGNITION INTERLOCK FROM 36 MONTHS TO 24 MONTHS.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Attend Victim Impact Panel on 01-20-2016.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of New Berlin Police Department.  Blood draw costs, DNA surcharge and Transcript Fee (to be forwarded to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions, commencing forthwith.  The Court orders the defendant be given access to his antibiotic eye drops.
2/2/2017 - ATC GRADUATE. COURT MODIFIES SENTENCE FROM 240 DAYS TO TIME SERVED OF 55 DAYS.
